reviews.text: Stayed here for one night coming through Can Tho. Very nice hotel in great location on the main street. Value is great considering the size and quality of room you get. Only complaint would be the breakfast. Got there around 9am, the only people there. Hardly any food anywhere. Had toast as the food was that there looked off.
reviews.title: Great hotel, terrible breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were pleasant and welcoming on arrival although very little command of English. We had requested a river view room when booking several weeks before hand but were given a room at the side of the hotel with a partial view of the river. We were offered another room on the same floor with great views of the river but it absolutely stank of cigarette smoke. We were shown several others on different floors but all the river view ones seemed to be for smokers and smelt accordingly (I think they were the room numbers ending 07 and 08 on each floor). In the end we decided to stay in the allocated room which was a nice size with good en-suite. It was decorated in a pleasant minimalist style. If the smoking element doesn’t bother you go for the highest rooms available as even at the front of the hotel the view from the lower rooms are partially obscured by the another hotel to the side.
reviews.title: If you want the best rooms take up smoking !!

reviews.text: Breakfast was taken in a large dining room on the first floor and there was plenty of it and a wide variety of dishes.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in quaint town

reviews.text: What the hotel fails dismally to capitalise on is its roof top terrace. The views from there are fantastic, especially at night. However we went up there a couple of times during the day and couldn’t find any staff. We did have a drink there one evening but there was only one other table occupied. Whilst we didn’t eat there the food did look nice, and not badly priced. They could do so much with the place.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very disappointed in Can Tho, and much of the Mekong Delta generally for that matter. There is only one bar which is anything like what you think of as a bar (even that didn’t have vodka - much to my wife’s disappointment) and nowhere is open very late. The two restaurants we tried, however, were excellent apart from some large groups of older Germans who insisted on trying to out sing each other making it a less than pleasant experience for everyone else (SAGA louts!).
reviews.title: Nice room and nice view of the Mekong

reviews.text: We only stayed here one night at part of a 2 day Mekong Delta tour but really liked this Hotel. The rooms where really modern, spotless and spacious with a great large bathroom with the strongest massage shower I have ever had. The room was very quiet with a side view of the river and bridge and the hotel is in an excellent location a 2 min walk from the riverfront and restaurants, and they have a great buffet breakfast. The only down side was the receptionist who was not very helpfull and looked at you with that "what do you want, you are disturbing me" look. When we checked I asked her if she could book a bus to Rach Gia for the next day, which she agreed, when we returned from dinner I asked if she had managed to book it and she said yes, no problem but when we got up to the room she rang to say that the bus was full for the time we had requested so she had not tried to book it at all untill then.
reviews.title: Lovely Smart Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed here 1 night, but the hotel and the town were a pleasant surprise. Great value with a good level of service and a clean comfortable room.
reviews.title: A good option for Can Tho

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower wasn't great and there was some noise from the disco but neither of these mentions should put anyone off booking here.
reviews.title: No problems

reviews.text: Can Tho was a town we transited through on the way to Phu Quoc but the town itself was interesting, and the hotel very well located to the main area.
reviews.title: Nice and comfortable

reviews.text: While not as cheap as hotels in Saigon, for our US$40 we got a clean room, pleny of space in our room and a pretty decent breakfast. While we only stayed one night here we didn't have any problems with the hotel or the staff. We arrived quite late to beakfast (about 8:45am) and there was still plently of great food to choose from. Granted the majority was more Vietnamese style foods but there was still plenty of fresh bread, jams, and lots of fruit if you don't like noodles for breakfast.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights on the 8th floor so we had a room with very good Mekong river view. The room was good and the shower was modern too. Breakfast was good except fruit juice was always run out. It's very convenient to walk to the river for a boat trip. A short walk to the local market and restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Wow...very good Mekong river view...a nice hotel...

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Location is ideal within walking distance of downtown. Hotel overlooked Mekong Delta River. You can have a drink up on their roof top bar. It’s nothing fancy, but does have a great view.
reviews.title: Overnighter

reviews.text: Hotel was very clean. Our room was large enough that we didn’t have to worry about where we placed our suitcases. Our room had 2 twin beds.
reviews.title: Nice and clean room

reviews.text: Hotel had a nice breakfast buffet in the second floor restaurant; it might have been nice up on the rooftop.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms

reviews.text: Overall, the stay was very pleasant, I’d stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms and Location, Great (FREE) Buffet, Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: KimTho Hotel Can Tho
reviews.title: Excellent value,slightly quirky hotel

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights here in August 2010.
reviews.title: I rate this hotel 4 stars (without the price)!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small, handily located hotel close to the river and our 'superior' room had a great view over that.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It also had a ‘birth control drawer’ containing 2 condoms. In all my travels I have never seen such a thing before! Hilarious. Also the mini bar had 2 flavours of instant noodles; I forgot to note the price. There was no price noted for the b-c drawer, so I guess that was gratis…
reviews.title: Good hotel for a short stay in Can Tho

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise the room was as you’d expect. Large enough, with plenty of space for luggage, which we came to realise, was standard in Vietnam.
reviews.title: Comfortable bed, clean hotel
